Package model

Class BSModel

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
model.BSModel
public class BSModel
extends java.util.Observable
The all-important model for this game of battleship. It stores many areas of state, and informs the BSView should any of it change. Here are stored miscellania such as ship names, as well as important information such as those ships' sizes. Most importantly, the grids are stored as a char[][] for low memory-cost checks and storage. The shipStates also control the game,
Version:
JDK 14.0.1
Author:
Matthew Ricci

  • Field Details

    • GRID_SIZE

      public static final int GRID_SIZE
      The dimension of the square grid.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SHIP_SIZES

      public static final int[] SHIP_SIZES
      The corresponding sizes of the ships.

    • SHIP_NAMES

      public static final java.lang.String[] SHIP_NAMES
      The names of the ships used in this game. To find their lengths, match up indices with SHIP_SIZES.

    • shipStates

      public Ship[] shipStates
      Tracking the state of the ships, so we can check if they're sunken or not.

  • Constructor Details

    • BSModel

      public BSModel()
      The constructor. Simply allows it to be made.

  • Method Details

    • addAsObserver

      public void addAsObserver​(java.util.Observer o)
      Adds an Observer to this Observable. Lets you add an observer. Of course, the BSView is generally going to be the only observer, but this allows you to add it.
      Parameters:
      o - the Observer that you want to pass in.

    • updateGridWithHit

      public boolean updateGridWithHit​(java.awt.Point point, boolean myTurn)
      Update the grid with a hit. Updates the grid with a hit. If it's your turn, it makes sure to only update the enemy grid. Otherwise, it will update your grid. This is where the 2d grid with letters shines. It allows for a quick retrieval and check. Some debug messages are here for convenience. See the in-line comments for more information.
      Parameters:
      point - the Point that you want to hit
      myTurn - true if it's your turn, false if not
      Returns:
      true if the hit was valid, false if not

    • updateShipStates

      public void updateShipStates​(java.awt.Point point)
      A ship has been hit so we update it. A ship has been hit. The Ship that corresponds to that point is retrieved, and setHit() is called, registering a hit to it.
      Parameters:
      point - the Point at which the ship was hit.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Verifies if the game is over by checking ship states. Checks if the game is over. If even one ship is not sunk, then the game must go on. Otherwise, all ships must be sunk for someone and the game must end.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false if not

    • updateGridWithShips

      public void updateGridWithShips​(java.awt.Point point, Ship ship, Directions dir)
      Updates the grid with ships when they are permanently placed. When the user decides to place a ship, this is the method that updates the 2d array representing the grid and notifies the view for GUI processing. It does a few boolean checks just like the GUI does and then is able to place it.
      Parameters:
      point - the point origin of the ship
      ship - the Ship object containing important information about that ship, such as its length
      dir - whether or not the ship is pointed up or left.

    • updateOtherGridWithShips

      public void updateOtherGridWithShips​(java.awt.Point point, Ship ship, Directions dir)
      A testing oriented method, allowing you to place ships on the other grid. A testing oriented method that allows bypassing of the GUI so you can place ships on the other board for testing purposes. It works the same, except it places it on the other grid instead of having to wait for a socket connection.
      Parameters:
      point - the point origin of the ship
      ship - the Ship object containing important information about that ship, such as its length
      dir - whether or not the ship is pointed up or left.

    • initGrid

      public void initGrid​(WhichGrid whichGrid)
      Makes empty grids to initialize them. Make the empty grids for the view to base off of. This is an important part of the reset() method in BSView.
      Parameters:
      whichGrid - whether or not it's yours or their grid

    • initShipStates

      public void initShipStates()
      Initializes the Ship[] tracking the state of the ships. Initializes the ship states for the reset() method in BSView. This will populate the Ship[] with all the corresponding Ships in their default values. Note that we use the Prototype pattern here since the Ships only really vary in length.

    • endGame

      public void endGame​(boolean iWin)
      Ends the game, showing an Alert. End the game by making an Alert object to pass to the BSView. Makes different ones depending on if you won or lost.
      Parameters:
      iWin - true if you won, false if not.
